result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Davis Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Davis Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael Davis Jr was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Marcus McC and/or Willie F
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
  - Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.  Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 7

Defendant appeared.  Cara J Throckmorton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
